segments.text: I hear the water rushing, and it’s terrifying in its persistence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman appears so serene, polishing that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can see the chaos unfolding behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, balancing perilously on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so innocent, her palm raised in hope.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet here we are, on the brink of accidents, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s absurd how focused she is; the contrast is almost comedic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Shouldn’t she be aware of her surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Right now, everything feels on edge, like a tightrope act without a net.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only watch as the water slips over the edge, unaware of its own calamity.
segments.speaker: PAR
